name: @sapphire/plugin-logger
readme:
![Sapphire Logo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sapphiredev/assets/main/banners/SapphireCommunity.png) # @sapphire/plugin-logger **Plugin for @sapphire/framework to have pretty console output.** [![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/sapphiredev/plugins)](https://github.com/sapphiredev/plugins/blob/main/LICENSE.md) [![npm bundle size](https://img.shields.io/bundlephobia/min/@sapphire/plugin-logger?logo=webpack&style=flat-square)](https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=@sapphire/plugin-logger) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@sapphire/plugin-logger?color=crimson&logo=npm&style=flat-square)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sapphire/plugin-logger)
## Description A Logger implementation that implements Sapphire's `ILogger` interface and implements timestamp and style formatting with the blazing fast [`colorette`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/colorette) library. ## Features - Fully ready for TypeScript! - Includes ESM ready entrypoint - [`NO_COLOR`](https://no-color.org) friendly, inherited by colorette ## Installation `@sapphire/plugin-logger` depends on the following packages. Be sure to install these along with this package! - [`@sapphire/framework`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sapphire/framework) You can use the following command to install this package, or replace `npm install` with your package manager of choice. ```sh npm install @sapphire/plugin-logger @sapphire/framework ``` --- ## Usage This registers the necessary options and methods in the Sapphire client to be able to use the log plugin. ```typescript // Main bot file // Be sure to register the plugin before instantiating the client. import '@sapphire/plugin-logger/register'; ``` In order to use the Logger in any place other than a piece (commands, arguments, preconditions, etc.), you must first import the `container` property of `@sapphire/framework`. For pieces, you can simply use `this.container.logger` to access Logger methods. ```typescript import { container } from '@sapphire/framework'; export class MyAwesomeService { public printAwesomeLog() { container.logger.info('log message'); } } ``` Here is an example ping command, demonstrating the use of `this.container.logger` from within a piece by omitting the explicit import. ```typescript // ping command import { Command } from '@sapphire/framework'; import type { Message } from 'discord.js'; export class PingCommand extends Command { public constructor(context: Command.LoaderContext, options: Command.Options) { super(context, { ...options, description: 'ping pong' }); } public async messageRun(message: Message) { this.container.logger.warn('warning message'); } } ``` ## Types of logs 1. `trace` 1. `debug` 1. `info` 1. `warn` 1. `error` 1. `fatal` > Example: `container.logger.debug('log debug message');` ## Buy us some doughnuts Sapphire Community is and always will be open source, even if we don't get donations. That being said, we know there are amazing people who may still want to donate just to show their appreciation. Thank you very much in advance! We accept donations through Open Collective, Ko-fi, Paypal, Patreon and GitHub Sponsorships. You can use the buttons below to donate through your method of choice. | Donate With | Address | | :-------------: | :-------------------------------------------------: | | Open Collective | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/opencollective) | | Ko-fi | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/kofi) | | Patreon | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/patreon) | | PayPal | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/paypal) | ## Contributors Please make sure to read the [Contributing Guide][contributing] before making a pull request. Thank you to all the people who already contributed to Sapphire! [contributing]: https://github.com/sapphiredev/.github/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

comment.description: The logger class.
The console this writes to.
The inspect depth when logging objects.
The formats supported by the logger.
The string `write` will join values by.
Gets whether or not colorette is enabled.
Alias of {@link ILogger.write} with {@link LogLevel.Debug} as level.
The values to log.
Alias of {@link ILogger.write} with {@link LogLevel.Error} as level.
The values to log.
Alias of {@link ILogger.write} with {@link LogLevel.Fatal} as level.
The values to log.
Checks whether a level is supported.
The level to check.
Alias of {@link ILogger.write} with {@link LogLevel.Info} as level.
The values to log.
Pre-processes an array of values.
The values to pre-process.
Alias of {@link ILogger.write} with {@link LogLevel.Trace} as level.
The values to log.
Alias of {@link ILogger.write} with {@link LogLevel.Warn} as level.
The values to log.
Writes the log message given a level and the value(s).
The log level.
The values to log.
Logger utility that stores and applies a full style into the message.
The infix, added between the timestamp and the message.
The style formatter for the message.
The timestamp formatter.
Logger utility that applies a style to a string.
Applies the style to a string.
The value to apply the style to.
Logger utility that formats a timestamp.
The logger style to apply the color to the timestamp.
The final formatter.
The timestamp used to format the current date.
Whether or not the logger will show a timestamp in UTC.
Formats the current time.
The background colors.
The text styles.
The text colors.
The logger format options.
The logger options for the debug level, used when calling {@link ILogger.debug}.
The logger options for the error level, used when calling {@link ILogger.error}.
The logger options for the critical level, used when calling {@link ILogger.fatal}.
The logger options for the info level, used when calling {@link ILogger.info}.
The logger options for an unknown or uncategorised level.
The logger options for the lowest log level, used when calling {@link ILogger.trace}.
The logger options for the warning level, used when calling {@link ILogger.warn}.
The options for {@link LoggerLevel}.
The infix to be included between the timestamp and the message.
The style options for the message.
The timestamp options. Set to `null` to disable timestamp parsing.
The logger options.
The default options used to fill all the possible values for {@link LoggerOptions.format}.
The inspect depth when logging objects.

The options for each log level. LogLevel.None serves to set the default for all keys, where only
{@link LoggerTimestampOptions.timestamp} and {@link LoggerLevelOptions.prefix} would be overridden.
The string that joins different messages.
The minimum log level.
A writable stream for the error logs.
A writable stream for the output logs.
The options for {@link LoggerStyle}.
The background color, e.g. `magenta` or `red`.
The text effects, e.g. `italic`, `strikethrough`, etc.
The text color, e.g. `red` or `yellow`.
The formatter used for {@link LoggerTimestampOptions}. This will be run **after** applying the color to the formatter.
The options for {@link LoggerTimestamp}.
The color to use.
The formatter. See {@link LoggerTimestampFormatter} for more information.
The {@link Timestamp} pattern.
Whether or not the date should be UTC.
The value accepted by {@link LoggerStyle}'s constructor. Read `colorette`'s documentation for more information.

The [@sapphire/plugin-logger](https://github.com/sapphiredev/plugins/blob/main/packages/logger) version that you are currently using.
An example use of this is showing it of in a bot information command.

Note to Sapphire developers: This needs to explicitly be `string` so it is not typed as the string that gets replaced by esbuild
